creator: jnaveen@ltp.soft.net
text:
I think it will be useful to specify a property/wild card as a target name. 
For example 
<target name="{target.name}" depends="init">
 <ant antfile="package-build.xml" dir="${env.root}/ttr/src" 
      target="${build.target.name}"/>
</target>

OR a comma separated target name

<target name="dev, release" depends="init">
 <ant antfile="package-build.xml" dir="${env.root}/ttr/src" 
      target="${build.target.name}"/>
</target>

This is a *super* feature to have. If this was allowed, my build scripts would 
have looked awesome.

The idea here is that the "init" target sets up properties related to 
the current package and these properties are porpogated to a common build file.
This avoids a lot of re-write.

this would break all builds that already used targets named "a,b", and confuse 
IDEs no end. Also, having a property which tells you the current target has 
been rejected on more than one occasion, for various reasons.

I think the example of how to do passdown to a sub build file is an 
interesting one, and there is no solution right now except have a very small 
number of targets to pass down (and a shallow structure). But I dont think a 
quick hack is the way to fix this.
